title: Subtype Schemas
description: This file defines the schemas for subtypes we define for openEO processes.

band-name.title: Band Name
band-name.description: Either a unique band name (metadata field `name`) or a [common band name](https://github.com/radiantearth/stac-spec/tree/0.9.0/extensions/eo#common-band-names) (metadata field `common_name`) available in the data cube. If unique band name and common name conflict, the unique band name has higher priority.

bounding-box.title: Bounding Box
bounding-box.description: A bounding box with the required fields `west`, `south`, `east`, `north` and optionally `base`, `height`, `crs`. The `crs` is a EPSG code, a WKT2:2018 string or a PROJ definition (deprecated).

base.description: Base (optional, lower left corner, coordinate axis 3).

height.description: Height (optional, upper right corner, coordinate axis 3).

crs.description: Coordinate reference system of the extent, specified as as [EPSG code](http://www.epsg-registry.org/), [WKT2 (ISO 19162) string](http://docs.opengeospatial.org/is/18-010r7/18-010r7.html) or [PROJ definition (deprecated)](https://proj.org/usage/quickstart.html). Defaults to `4326` (EPSG code 4326) unless the client explicitly requests a different coordinate reference system.

collection-id.title: Collection ID
collection-id.description: A collection id from the list of supported collections.

date.title: Date only
date.description: Date only representation, as defined for `full-date` by [RFC 3339 in section 5.6](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6). The time zone is UTC.

date-time.title: Date with Time
date-time.description: Date and time representation, as defined for `date-time` by [RFC 3339 in section 5.6](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

epsg-code.title: EPSG Code
epsg-code.description: Specifies details about cartographic projections as [EPSG](http://www.epsg.org) code.

file-path.title: Single File path
file-path.description: A relative path to a user-uploaded file. Folders can't be specified.

file-paths.title: Multiple File paths
file-paths.description: An array with relative paths to user-uploaded files. Clients should assist to generate a list of files for folders.

input-format.title: Input File Format
input-format.description: An input format supported by the back-end.

input-format-options.title: Options for Input File Formats
input-format-options.description: Key-value-pairs with arguments for the input format options supported by the back-end.

job-id.title: Batch Job ID
job-id.description: A batch job id, either one of the jobs a user has stored or a publicly available job.

kernel.title: Image Kernel
kernel.description: Image kernel, a two-dimensional array of numbers.

labeled-array.title: Array with labels
labeled-array.description:
An associative, ordered list of key-value pairs. Basically an array, which additionally has labels for each value. Labels can be numbers or (temporal) strings.

**Important:** Due to the lack of such a data type in JSON, the schema for the items is not formally specified yet and a placeholder.

output-format.title: Output File Format
output-format.description: An output format supported by the back-end.

output-format-options.title: Options for Output File Formats
output-format-options.description: Key-value-pairs with arguments for the output format options supported by the back-end.

process-graph.title: Process Graph (user-defined process)
process-graph.description: An process graph that is passed as an argument and is expected to be executed by the process. Parameters passed to the process graph are specified in the `parameters` property of the corresponding schema.

proj-definition.title: PROJ definition
proj-definition.description: **DEPRECATED.** Specifies details about cartographic projections as [PROJ](https://proj.org/usage/quickstart.html) definition.

raster-cube.title: Raster data cube
raster-cube.description: A raster data cube, an image collection stored at the back-end. Different back-ends have different internal representations for this data structure.

temporal-interval.title: Single temporal interval
temporal-interval.description:
Left-closed temporal interval, represented as two-element array with the following elements:

1. The first element is the start of the temporal interval. The specified instance in time is **included** in the interval.
2. The second element is the end of the temporal interval. The specified instance in time is **excluded** from the interval.

The specified temporal strings follow [RFC 3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339). Although [RFC 3339 prohibits the hour to be '24'](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.7), **this process allows the value '24' for the hour** of an end time in order to make it possible that left-closed time intervals can fully cover the day. `null` can be used to specify open intervals.

temporal-intervals.title: Multiple temporal intervals
temporal-intervals.description: Left-closed temporal intervals, which are allowed to overlap. Formatted as array of two-element arrays, each being an array with subtype `temporal-interval`.

time.title: Time only
time.description: Time only representation, as defined for `full-time` by [RFC 3339 in section 5.6](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6). Although [RFC 3339 prohibits the hour to be '24'](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.7), this definition allows the value '24' for the hour as end time in an interval in order to make it possible that left-closed time intervals can fully cover the day.

udf-code.title: UDF source code
udf-code.description: The (multi-line) source code of an user-defined function (UDF).

udf-runtime.title: UDF runtime
udf-runtime.description: The name of an UDF runtime.

udf-runtime-version.title: UDF Runtime version
udf-runtime-version.description: The version of an UDF runtime.

vector-cube.title: Vector data cube
vector-cube.description: A vector data cube, a vector collection stored at the back-end. Different back-ends have different internal representations for this data structure

wkt2-definition.title: WKT2 definition
wkt2-definition.description: Specifies details about cartographic projections as WKT2 string. Refers to the latest WKT2 version (currently [WKT2:2018](http://docs.opengeospatial.org/is/18-010r7/18-010r7.html) / ISO 19162:2018) unless otherwise stated by the process.
